parse.title: List of countries by beer consumption per capita

text.*:
Beer consumption per capita by country (2009). Measurements are shown in litres.

This is a list of countries ordered by annual per capita consumption of beer. Information not provided for some countries is not given in the available sources.

See also[edit]

Notes[edit]

  1. ^ Combination of per capita rates with respective populations at time of study. Data taken verbatim from the Kirin report.

References[edit]

  1. ^ a b Source, unless otherwise noted: Per Capita Beer Consumption by Country in 2016, Kirin Holdings Company. Table 3.
  2. ^ sectoresonline.com (September 2, 2011). "Una mala para el sector vitivinícola: en Argentina se consume más cerveza que vino". Andino (in Spanish). Archived from the original on May 8, 2014. Retrieved September 2, 2011. 
  3. ^ "Vietnamese consume 3.8 billion liters of beers in 2016". VnExpress. January 12, 2017. Retrieved January 12, 2017. 
  4. ^ a b c d e f g h i j "Beer consumption per capita in the Asia Pacific region in 2015, by country (in liters)". statista: the statistics portal. Retrieved 2018-09-02. 
  5. ^ "Annual volume of beer consumed per capita in France from 2008 to 2016". Retrieved August 9, 2018. 
  6. ^ "AssoBirra annual report 2016" (PDF). Retrieved January 8, 2017. 
  7. ^ "Beer - China". statista: the statistics portal. Retrieved 2018-09-02. 
  8. ^ "Beer - Hong Kong". statista: the statistics portal. Retrieved 2018-09-02. 
  9. ^ "Beer Consumption Per Capita in Israel". Retrieved 2018-09-04. 
  10. ^ "Kriz geldi, alkol tüketimi yüzde 20 arttı". NTVMSNBC. NTV. 2008. 
  11. ^ a b c Barigaba, Julius (August 17, 2009). "Uganda brewers toast to higher sales, thanks to low-end products". EastAfrican. Retrieved October 13, 2010. 
  12. ^ "Heineken Partners with Efes Breweries in Uzbekistan, Serbia and Kazakhstan". FlexNews. January 1, 2008. Retrieved October 13, 2010. 
  13. ^ "Lion seeks to reduce gearing through Rs. 1.2 bn. cash infusion". Sunday Island. August 16, 2009. Retrieved October 13, 2010.
